data.title: Groupe RATP - 2021 – Activity and sustainable development report
data.meta_description: Groupe RATP - 2021 – Activity and sustainable development report
data.text:
Rapidly growing SUBSIDIARIES

2021 was the “growth” year for subsidiaries. They contributed a quarter of Group turnover and this proportion should reach 30% in 2022. RATP Dev started major contracts in Tuscany and Egypt and renewed all its contracts in the United States. Two new subsidiaries, RATP CAP Île‑de‑France and RATP Solutions Ville, started operating with very substantial contracts. Finally, the consultancy and engineering group Systra, world leader in transport infrastructure design, with a 43.4% holding from RATP Group, grew by over 20% with a record order intake of €880 million.

RESPONSIBLE COMMITMENTS

3,453

new hires in the Île-de-France region by RATP in 2021

5,074

100 points

210,000

beneficiaries of Foundation actions in 2021

70%

S3A label

All metro and tram lines, RER line A and B and 16 bus routes have the S3A label (denoting welcome, support and accessibility)

1,200

clean buses (700 biomethane and 494 electric) in operation in April 2022 in the Île‑de‑France region fleet

99.6%

of RATP waste recovered in 2021

INVESTMENTS AT THE SERVICE OF MOBILITY FOR ALL

€2,708 M

of consolidated investments for RATP Group, up 18% compared with 2020

€2,364 M

invested in the Île‑de‑France region with the support of Île‑de‑France Mobilités, up 8% compared with 2020, of which €1,159 M for upgrade and maintenance of the network and infrastructure, along with renewal of rolling stock

€178 M
